item.title: Purple People Eater Ukulele Play Along With Key Changes - Key of D, Eb, E, F
item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for GCEA Ukulele. Keys of D, Eb, E, and F.
Chords Used: D, G, A7, Eb, Ab, Bb7, E, A, B7, F, Bb, C7
As performed by Sheb Wooley.
Tutorial Video (GCEA & DGBE): https://youtu.be/l285RIIffvo
******************** Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion.
Check out the UkeStuff Podcast, where I talk about ukulele education and my own ukulele experiences. Available on Radio Public, Apple Podcasts, Google Play, Spotify, and Stitcher. If you don't have a podcast app, please check out Radio Public for all your podcasts--they support podcasters financially.
You are invited to visit my ukulele blog/website, ukestuff.info (a free resource). Also on social media: Twitter (@UkeStuff) and Instagram (@ukestuff.info)
Check out the "merch": https://teespring.com/stores/ukestuff
Thanks for watching the videos and supporting the channel! Your support of these videos and subscription to the channel makes it possible to produce this content.

item.title: Simon & Garfunkel - Scarborough Fair / Canticle - Key of E
item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for GCEA ukulele. Key of E Dorian (built on the second step of the D Major scale)
Chords Used: Em, D, G, A
As performed by Simon & Garfunkel
Tutorial Video (GCEA & DGBE): https://youtu.be/M0x_G4eA71w
Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. The ukulele chord font is available at ukefarm.com. The art work is by Pieter Brueghel the Younger (1534-1638) and is entitled "Flemish Fair."
Do you have a request for a song to be made into a video? First, check the index of play alongs at www.ukeplayalongs.com to make sure your song isn't already available. If it isn't, please fill out this request form: https://forms.gle/84rgm7kFNJWnTqFB6
We cannot promise that a request will be made into a play along, but we do appreciate your recommendations!
Interested in UkeStuff merchandise? https://teespring.com/stores/ukestuff
Check out the UkeStuff Podcast, where I talk about ukulele education and my own ukulele experiences. Available on Radio Public, Apple Podcasts, Google Play, Spotify, and Stitcher.
And you are invited to visit my ukulele blog/website, ukestuff.info (free).
Thanks for watching the videos and supporting the channel! Your support of these videos and subscription to the channel makes it possible to produce this content.
